channel.title: Stupid question..but i have never looked into it >> command.substring(X);
channel.description:
[size=17pt]PROBLEM RESOLVED, Thank you Jordiescape[/size] [size=17pt]-----------------[/size] Original post:
Ok so im making a something like so
[code] String noob = command.substring(7); [/code]
what is the difference between
command.substring(7);
and
command.substring(5);
and all the others such as
command.substring(4);[tt][/tt]

item.title: Stupid question..but i have never looked into it >> command.substring(X);
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.source: Stupid question..but i have never looked into it >> command.substring(X);

item.title: Stupid question..but i have never looked into it >> command.substring(X);
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“Jordiescape, post:2, topic:243276”]Well, for example;

if (command.startsWith("hello")) {

For that the command substring would be 6. Basically think of it as this; The amount of letters in the actual word, (5) + the space (1). Tell me if I didn’t explain good enough.[/quote]

Lol oh, that’s the easiest thing in the world. thank you.

Read full topic

@Jordiescape wrote:

Well, for example;

if (command.startsWith("hello")) {

For that the command substring would be 6. Basically think of it as this; The amount of letters in the actual word, (5) + the space (1). Tell me if I didn’t explain good enough.
